abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Energy Efficiency
            Project for Poland were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory: risk to global environment outcome was
            moderate; bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory;
            and borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes; (i) innovative instruments should
            be kept simple with low transaction costs; (ii) Energy
            Service Company (ESCOs) need financial safety net in
            start-up phase; (iii) strong project pipeline is essential;
            (iv) active government and state institution role needed for
            an enabling ESCO environment; and (v) guarantee instruments
            often not critical for Energy Efficiency (EE) lending to happen.
